title: John Diefenbaker
summary: John George Diefenbaker PC CH QC FRSC FRSA (/ˈdiːfənˌbeɪkər/; September 18, 1895 – August 16, 1979) was a Canadian politician who served as the 13th prime minister of Canada from 1957 to 1963. Between 1930 and 1979, he was the only federal Progressive Conservative (PC or Tory)[lower-alpha 1] leader to lead his party to an election victory, doing so three times, although only once with a majority of seats in the House of Commons of Canada.
